intro: Berkheya alba, commonly known as the white berkheya, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, white to pale yellow ray florets. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb with slender, branching stems and hairy leaves. Its flowers bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Berkheya alba is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its delicate appearance.
